snippet: A government-run teacher evaluation bureaucracy would be a disaster for the teaching profession — and thus the future of public education — in our country.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Deborah Kenny, head of charter school network Harlem Village Academies, asserts that imposing state-run teacher evaluation systems will undermine principals, demean teachers and generally be a disaster for the teaching profession and the future of public education; calls for principals, not the government, to carry out individual teacher evaluations.
lead_paragraph: A government-run teacher evaluation bureaucracy would be a disaster for the teaching profession — and thus the future of public education — in our country.

headline.main: Want to Ruin Teaching? Give Ratings
headline.print_headline: Want to Ruin Teaching? Give Ratings
